channel.title: Teches on Kostya's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Teches on Kostya's Blog

item.title: Reading through HEX
item.description: Right now I am improving our exchange connectivity libraries. And one of the regular activities is anaylzing tcpdumps to validate what was sent over the wire. Doing this for nearly for the whole week I found couple of tricks. Jumping to the end of frame Let’s say you have some frame-oriented protocol, like websocket or EUREX ETI. Usually, message in those protocols start from the message_size field, then the message body follows, then the next message and so on.
